alert.note: Alert for Gloucester; Mathews; Middlesex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 10 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN GLOUCESTER... SOUTHEASTERN MIDDLESEX AND NORTHWESTERN MATHEWS COUNTIES THROUGH 330 AM EDT... At 300 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hartfield, or 7 miles northeast of Gloucester Courthouse, moving north at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Gloucester, southeastern Middlesex and northwestern Mathews Counties, including the following locations... Dutton, Hardyville, Cobbs Creek, Wilton, Harmony Village, Fort Nonsense, Grafton, Harcum, Healys, and Soles. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
